thread.title: Florida Airport Shooter Identified As Esteban Santiago From New Jersey, Reportedly Had Military ID – UPDATED
thread.title_full: Florida Airport Shooter Identified As Esteban Santiago From New Jersey, Reportedly Had Military ID – UPDATED

author: Andrew Mark Miller
title: Florida Airport Shooter Identified As Esteban Santiago From New Jersey, Reportedly Had Military ID – UPDATED
text:
Do you like this article? 
The situation in Fort Lauderdale, Florida has been hard to figure out. 
13 people were shot and at least five have been killed. 
The shooter was contained and taken into custody near the baggage claim area. 
But then, all of a sudden, a loud noise was heard in a nearby parking garage. 
Then reports of shots fired in a nearby terminal. 
Then we immediately saw reports of another active shooter situation . 
Chaotic to say the least. 
However, we do know who the shooter is according to Senator Bill Nelson. NOW: someone in handcuffs at Fort Lauderdale Hollywood International. Still lots of activity in parking garage. @wsvn pic.twitter.com/kjHA1QNI3Z 
— Brian Entin (@BrianEntin) January 6, 2017 NEW: Suspected shooter in Fort Lauderdale airport shooting has been identified; at least 5 people killed. https://t.co/5FwpPaUJyu pic.twitter.com/xuIyY3nfEe 
From Mirror : 
The suspected shooter behind the rampage at a Florida Airport has been named as Esteban Santiago and was reportedly carrying military identification. 
Senator Bill Nelson named Santiago on MSNBC, saying he was carrying military identification 
Santiago is reportedly 26 years old and appeared alone in the Terminal 2 baggage claim area wearing a Star Wars shirt. 
It is unclear if the picture above is Santiago but that man was arrested on the scene. 
There are pictures flying all around Twitter of different people who are supposedly the shooter. 
It is being reported that Esteban Santiago is from New Jersey. 
We are seeing reports that the man checked his gun in his bag and arrived at the airport on a Canadien flight but the Canadien embassy is disputing that. NBC saying Santiago got his gun from a checked bag, went into the bathroom to load it, came out and started shooting. Security fail. 
— Ethan Ralph (@TheRalphRetort) January 6, 2017 
We will keep you updated. 
It is looking like the reports of a second shooter were inaccurate. 
(K.R.) UPDATE – There is chaos at Ft Lauderdale-Hollywood International Airport in Florida right now, following a mass…
